content:
MethodResponse Class

Definition

Implements the IMethodReturnMessage interface to create a message that acts as a method response on a remote object.

In this Article

[System.CLSCompliant(false)]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComVisible(true)]
[System.Security.SecurityCritical]
public class MethodResponse : System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.IMethodReturnMessage, System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable
Inheritance
System.Object
MethodResponse

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

A MethodResponse is generated as a result of a method called on a remote object, and is used to return the results of the method call back to the caller. The message includes a return value and out arguments.

The MethodResponse class is used by the remoting infrastructure of the .NET Framework. You do not need to create an instance of the MethodResponse class directly; instead, use the IMethodReturnMessage interface.

MethodResponse contains remoting data at the end of the message sink. A remoting server returns a MethodResponse message to a client.

Constructors

MethodResponse(Header[],IMethodCallMessage)

Initializes a new instance of the MethodResponse class from an array of remoting headers and a request message.

public MethodResponse (System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.Header[] h1, System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.IMethodCallMessage mcm);
h1
Header[]

An array of remoting headers that contains key/value pairs. This array is used to initialize MethodResponse fields for headers that belong to the namespace "http://schemas.microsoft.com/clr/soap/messageProperties".

mcm
IMethodCallMessage

A request message that acts as a method call on a remote object.

Remarks

The MethodResponse class is used by the remoting infrastructure of the .NET Framework. You do not need to create an instance of the MethodResponse class directly; instead, use the IMethodReturnMessage interface.

Fields

ExternalProperties

Specifies an IDictionary interface that represents a collection of the remoting message's properties.

protected System.Collections.IDictionary ExternalProperties;

Remarks

The ExternalProperties field is also accessible through the Properties property.

InternalProperties

Specifies an IDictionary interface that represents a collection of the remoting message's properties.

protected System.Collections.IDictionary InternalProperties;

Properties

Gets the number of arguments passed to the method.

public int ArgCount { get; }
Value
Int32

A Int32 that represents the number of arguments passed to a method.

Remarks

The method belongs to a remote object.

Gets an array of arguments passed to the method.

public object[] Args { get; }
Value
Object[]

An array of type Object that represents the arguments passed to a method.

Remarks

The method belongs to a remote object.

Exception

Gets the exception thrown during the method call, or null if the method did not throw an exception.

public Exception Exception { get; }
Value
Exception

The Exception thrown during the method call, or null if the method did not throw an exception.

Remarks

The method belongs to a remote object.

Gets a value that indicates whether the method can accept a variable number of arguments.

Value
Boolean

true if the method can accept a variable number of arguments; otherwise, false.

Remarks

The method belongs to a remote object.

Gets the LogicalCallContext for the current method call.

public System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.LogicalCallContext LogicalCallContext { get; }
Value
LogicalCallContext

The LogicalCallContext for the current method call.

Remarks

The method belongs to a remote object.

MethodBase

Gets the MethodBase of the called method.

public System.Reflection.MethodBase MethodBase { get; }
Value
MethodBase

The MethodBase of the called method.

Remarks

The method belongs to a remote object.

MethodName

Gets the name of the invoked method.

public string MethodName { get; }
Value
String

A String that contains the name of the invoked method.

Remarks

The method belongs to a remote object.

MethodSignature

Gets an object that contains the method signature.

public object MethodSignature { get; }
Value
System.Object

A Object that contains the method signature.

Remarks

The method belongs to a remote object.

OutArgCount

Gets the number of arguments in the method call marked as ref or out parameters.

public int OutArgCount { get; }
Value
Int32

A Int32 that represents the number of arguments in the method call marked as ref or out parameters.

Remarks

The method belongs to a remote object.

OutArgs

Gets an array of arguments in the method call that are marked as ref or out parameters.

public object[] OutArgs { get; }
Value
Object[]

An array of type Object that represents the arguments in the method call that are marked as ref or out parameters.

Remarks

The method belongs to a remote object.

Properties

Gets an IDictionary interface that represents a collection of the remoting message's properties.

public virtual System.Collections.IDictionary Properties { get; }
Value
IDictionary

An IDictionary interface that represents a collection of the remoting message's properties.

Remarks

The Properties property returns the value of the ExternalProperties field.

ReturnValue

Gets the return value of the method call.

public object ReturnValue { get; }
Value
System.Object

A Object that represents the return value of the method call.

Remarks

The method belongs to a remote object.

TypeName

Gets the full type name of the remote object on which the method call is being made.

public string TypeName { get; }
Value
String

A String that contains the full type name of the remote object on which the method call is being made.

Uri

Gets the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of the remote object on which the method call is being made.

public string Uri { get; set; }
Value
String

The URI of a remote object.

Gets a method argument, as an object, at a specified index.

Int32

The index of the requested argument.

Returns

index
Int32

Returns

GetObjectData(SerializationInfo,StreamingContext)

The GetObjectData method is not implemented.

public virtual void GetObjectData (System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo info, System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext context);
info
SerializationInfo

Data for serializing or deserializing the remote object.

context
StreamingContext

Context of a certain serialized stream.

Remarks

The GetObjectData method throws a NotSupportedException.

GetOutArg(Int32)

argNum
Int32

Remarks

The method belongs to a remote object.

Returns the name of the specified argument marked as a ref parameter or an out parameter.

index
Int32

The index of the requested argument.

Returns
String

The argument name, or null if the current method is not implemented.

Remarks

The method belongs to a remote object.

HeaderHandler(Header[])

Initializes an internal serialization handler from an array of remoting headers that are applied to a method.

public virtual object HeaderHandler (System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.Header[] h);
h
Header[]

An array of remoting headers that contain key/value pairs. This array is used to initialize MethodResponse fields for headers that belong to the namespace "http://schemas.microsoft.com/clr/soap/messageProperties".

Returns
System.Object

An internal serialization handler.

Remarks

The method belongs to a remote object. The value of the first header in the input array is the method name.

RootSetObjectData(SerializationInfo,StreamingContext)

Sets method information from serialization settings.

public void RootSetObjectData (System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo info, System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext ctx);
info
SerializationInfo

The data for serializing or deserializing the remote object.

ctx
StreamingContext

The context of a certain serialized stream.

Remarks

The method belongs to a remote object.
